review: Last update killed the Android Version. As another user reported, the toolbar (which used to be on top), like the full desktop version, is now at the bottom, and very difficult to use. Totally counter intutive. It's become like the mobile version, which is difficult to use. It fails to take advantage of the larger size of android tablets. Microsoft. Please fix!

Create powerful spreadsheets. Easily edit documents and collaborate on the go. The Excel spreadsheet app lets you create, view, edit, and share your files with others quickly and easily. Sheets can easily be checked, edited and shared on the go. Excel makes it easy to review and analyze data, budgets more while you view and edit workbooks attached to email messages. Edit documents for data analysis, accounting, finance, or any other fields with confidence. When on the go, your data and office.

I remember the years when excel was a necessary evil. And there were sooo many years like that. They've shown marked improvement over the past 6 or 8 years which has made me an excel fan boy. Their Android app is amazing!! Simple, easy to use, yet has so many features for a mobile app. Don't think that you'll even come close to the full desktop version, but you can do more than you would think. Great job MS!!

It is pretty good especially on a tablet. The larger screen helps. On my phone it is okay to view, but to enter anything or manipulate the borders of cells is nearly impossible. I don't know what the solution of that would be because that is a constraint of the size of the device. In general, regarding the tablet, it would be nice to have things like cell size and word suggestion behave more like the PC/Windows version.

It's not bad for an app based spreadsheet. I use it for tracking my workouts so it's a pretty basic use. It did upload well from my original sheet and I can download it into my PC Excel to extract data, so that's good utility. Navigation is a bit difficult on a small phone touch screen. I dont know if it would be of much use with a more complicated spreadsheet but I haven'ttried that. So, ya, it's ok.

There's not really a lot to say about the industry standard. Kinda like saying "using metres is good". How others are judged against excel is more telling. I don't enjoy the interface on a screen rather than mouse and keyboard, but there is little else to do about that. I do appreciate the 'numbers keyboard, it covers most of the thing you need in that regard.

Absolutely fantastic. Was a little tricky at first, but keeping graphs has never been easier. I didn't know about the ads until I went to review the app, and I still haven't gotten any! This app is a must-have for busy people, with it's calculation format, and conditional formatting. Amazing job, Microsoft

I've been using excel mobile for years, and after the recent update noticed that I can no longer freeze panes. I primarily use it to track my workouts, and not being able to freeze the column with my workouts in it as the weeks go by is extremely tedious and frustrating, especially since I was able to do that for so long, and now it's just gone.

There is a bug (perhaps with dark mode) where the entry box to type in a cell show the text font color in the same color as the background. So the cursor will act like there is text there but I can't see the text to edit it. I have to jump from one app to any other app and back again, then the text is visible. Happens a lot.

Useless. Cannot edit page layout, margins, or view page borders. Cannot use select all or any other select command. Plus, it's missing about 100 other features. I put the simplest features because they are the most basic features this software should offer. This is the most broken database software I've ever used. Even the DOS versions I used on an old 286 NEC were more complete than this garbage. Don't install, and if you did, just delete it to save a headache.

I just download the app and after creating a document (specifically using "Total a List") my judgement... this excel tool kept closing while I attempted to insert new data, I needed to keep opening each time to finish the list, is not a big deal, but is likely that many people out there will get annoyed and frustrated, could you fix this issue please?... thank you, I am sure you will fix it.

Useless app. Can't sync Excel file with my laptop which has Excel 2019. I created the Excel file in this app on my phone. When I open Excel on my laptop the file is nowhere to be found. It's not in my One Drive on the laptop, nor on my OneDrive online. And I couldn't find a way to sync the two. MSFT is really losing ground. Google Drive just works, I don't have to do anything extra. Microsoft has really gone donwhill. OneDrive has never worked good to begin with. Can't even rename a file!

(THIS IS NOT A REPLICA OF THE DESKTOP APP LEARN TO ACCEPT THE FACT THAT YOUR PHONE IS NOT A PC) Amazing, Definitely worth it. I am NOT sugarcoating, this is 99% of Microsoft Excel baked into a phone. The 1% is key shortcuts, but the portability is worth the small cut. If I could, I would give a 4.7 star review just to highlight the polish and highlight the problems.

I need to get in touch with someone from customer support!! I've lost some really important documents because the fact that the app keeps crashing, tried reinstalling, just to find out the the document's shortcut doesn't even show up anymore!!! No f@%$!$ way this is happening right now!!!

Well, its not good as windows version. But its enough for android. This app is better than other similar apps. They made interface mostly close to the desktop version. No ads. No app crashes. Working smoothly. Its working very well in tablets.

Microsoft really sucks at cloud compared to google, but the fact that they offer the online version free is honestly so worth the switch considering that employers value the experience with the MS Office suite so much more (or at least I think they used to). Lets be honest they do basically the same thing but might as well use all of the MS versions for personal use and put on your resume "word, excel, access, power point - expert level experience" üçªü•¥

Recursion seems to be very slow. But REDUCE is fast and is, in many instances, a good replacement. Error messages are very bad. But LAMBDA and LAMBDA helper functions together with STACK FUNCTIONS are very powerful.

Used to work well, but since the last month or so, I can't open any of my files from the mobile app. It just starts loading and fails every time no matter what I do. The only thing that works is opening the files from OneDrive, which is clunky and cumbersome.

While I love being able to use Excel on my tablet it still lacks the feel of the desktop version. No control click functions which is basic functionality. What's really strange is that there are Shift click functions for selecting multiple cells at once. Hopefully the control click functions for selection cells is in the pipeline.

It's great to have Execl on my Samsung Galaxy Fold 3. The large screen makes using Excel on the move much easier. I do miss some of the desktop features and not being able to use macros has prevented some of my spreadsheets from functioning in Excel Mobile.

The app is good on viewing completed docs, editing with a phone is difficult and feels unnatural. The thing I like the most is that all docs I've created with my PC I can access them at anytime and everywhere with either my phone or tablet.

As a long-time user of Excel in Windows, I love that it's available on Android but it can be irritating. It has no space character on the numeric keypad; it switches keypads incorrectly; a glitch often makes the formula bar text invisible; another glitch sometimes locks the keypad until you restart Excel.

It's definitely not a product for business use on a tablet or phone. Functionality is poor at best. Many other no cost products out there that do a better job. All you're paying for in the mobile environment is a name. As usual Microsoft throws products out there just because everybody else has them. It doesn't make them better.

Last update ruined the app. I'm unable to access any of my files through my mobile phone. I tried clearing all data, force stopping the app, uninstalling it several times, and even signing out of OneDrive and all other apps, but still nothing works. The app worked just fine until I updated.

Love Excel in the App on PC. My most used Windows app. Hate Excel via SharePoint..why bother. The Android App is also pretty bad Functionality in Excel for Apple is still not there. Fortunately I spend my day in W11 and its great. In 1990 I had an Impress overlay for Lotus 123 DOS that gave a wysiwyg view. And you could easily make cells 'flash'. It was terrific for warnings and getting attention in conditional formatting. Still can't in Excel 365.

As of 9/15/2022, Excel is not able to access files from Onedrive. This is true of several Samsung devices I own, both phones and tablets. Uninstalled and reinstalled both Excel and Onedrive apps on my devices, checked for updates, and still unable to access files from onedrive via the Excel android app. Any help would be appreciated.

It glitched and sent me to the bottom of the worksheet. I can't navigate back up without scrolling through millions of blank lines, and search function can't find anything data. And restarting the app just takes me back to where I stopped scrolling. It basically just rendered that worksheet useless on my phone

I had a bad experience while collaborating on shared files. The changes I make from the Excel Android app do not sync even with a fast internet connection. I keep seeing the old version of the file when I check the file on other devices.

I used this app for YEARS (WITHOUT needing to sign-in) to edit my budget xls but will switch to something else now since it has become useless and I can't edit anymore. It also forcebly keeps signing in (without asking me and even after deleting the work account) with my work account (which I don't use for personal stuff AT ALL) and then it uploads my personal xls files from my phone to my work onedrive for all to see! If you change sign in rules, NOTIFY ppl, don't just do what you want!

Suddenly I can only open files that have been shared with me. Any time I try to open a file in my own drive, it says "opening", then nothing happens. I have tried disconnecting and reconnecting, uninstalling and reinstalling, but the app is useless

When i try to delete this app necause its blocking othet things from downloading so i have spent the last 6 hours trying to figure out the problem cause this started happening when excel was automatically updating then when i cancel it, it starts to freeze so basicly im annoyed because ive been trying to download things and it does this. Like im so annoyed. And i havent had the best experience

I don't know what is happening. But in my S22 ultra the option freeze pane is not in the View menu. But in my other phone, it works just fine. I checked and they have the same app versions. Please fix this issue. It's so hard to use excel in this small screen without the freeze pane option.

The app is good, but got few bug with online file sync. One time I lost my file data, the file open almost empty it revert back to last week save. There time I cannot rename the file. The help is good but you have to explore because it got so many functions.

Functional. I think that sums it up. It doesn't do anything particularly well or particularly badly. Interface is a bit clunky and navigation/selection can be a pain, plus some functionality is so difficult to use that you eventually just stop using it. Overhaul the UI - totally - into something more useful and that'll bump up the rating by 1 or 2 stars. UPDATE: Marked as low as possible because of being constantly nagged to rate it, even though I've already rated it.

Love having this app on my phone. Its not easy to make major edits but does work well for small edits on the go. If I used it more I prob would be much quicker but it takes a little getting used to how to do it differently than PC

Using Excel from my phone with this app is arguably easier and faster than using it on my laptop! Love the app, I can adjust my spreadsheets from my phone when I'm not by a computer and it is so convenient and user friendly.

Now, there was an update, and once again, i cannot edit my files. new phone... I just updated my phone and now I can no longer edit my Excel spreadsheets. what happened? Need help getting fixed. I am now handcuffed when I travel. MS please reach out to me.... This just happened again So again today, I am using the app just fine and then it suddenly says i can no longer edit. New phone again and the same thing is happening. MS, please help. Thank you.

I was doing some exhausting work on spreadsheet then all of a sudden I got an error message to exit and open the file again to save, so as I'm compliant I did what it said. I exit, THEN MY WORK COMPLETELY VANISHED. NOT IN RECENTS. THE DAMN APP DOESNT HAVE A TRASHBIN. SO ALL OF MY WORK JUST, POOFED. THE AUTO SAVE WAS ON THE WHOLE TIME BUT IT DID NOT F-ING WORK AT ALL.

It's nice but some important functions don't work so the app is useless to me: 1. Can't read files from SD card 2.no data validation . 3. Drop down lists don't work Etc. I use my s8 tablet as a laptop replacement and this made me move to Google sheets. Hope Microsoft will fix these crucial issues

I really don't like the changes from the 2022 updates. Screwed up my formatting sheets and docs. Trying to locate formatting in my Mobil apps is a pain in the a. It's like learning the apps all over again.
